intro: Hoya mariae, commonly known as the Marie's Waxplant, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces fragrant, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Hoya mariae is a climbing plant that often uses aerial roots to attach itself to trees or other structures. It is relatively low-maintenance and thrives in bright, indirect light with moderate humidity.
